00101 /** @brief Representation of a range of positions in a source file.
00102 
00103     This class represents a range of characters in a source file
00104     (e.g. those that span a token's definition), from starting line and
00105     column to ending line and column.  (These values are tracked by the
00106     lexing code).  Both lines and columns are counted starting from one.
00107  */
00108 struct SourcePos {
00109     SourcePos(const char *n = NULL, int l = 0, int c = 0);
00110 
00111     const char *name;
00112     int first_line;
00113     int first_column;
00114     int last_line;
00115     int last_column;
00116 
00117     /** Prints the filename and line/column range to standard output. */
00118     void Print() const;
00119 
00120     /** Returns a LLVM DIFile object that represents the SourcePos's file */
00121     llvm::DIFile GetDIFile() const;
00122 
00123     bool operator==(const SourcePos &p2) const;
00124 };

00127 /** @brief Abstract base class for nodes in the abstract syntax tree (AST).
00128 
00129     This class defines a basic interface that all abstract syntax tree
00130     (AST) nodes must implement.  The base classes for both expressions
00131     (Expr) and statements (Stmt) inherit from this class.
00132 */
00133 class ASTNode {
00134 public:
00135     ASTNode(SourcePos p) : pos(p) { }
00136     virtual ~ASTNode();
00137 
00138     /** The Optimize() method should perform any appropriate early-stage
00139         optimizations on the node (e.g. constant folding).  The caller
00140         should use the returned ASTNode * in place of the original node.
00141         This method may return NULL if an error is encountered during
00142         optimization. */
00143     virtual ASTNode *Optimize() = 0;
00144 
00145     /** Type checking should be performed by the node when this method is
00146         called.  In the event of an error, a NULL value may be returned.
00147         As with ASTNode::Optimize(), the caller should store the returned
00148         pointer in place of the original ASTNode *. */
00149     virtual ASTNode *TypeCheck() = 0;
00150 
00151     virtual int EstimateCost() const = 0;
00152 
00153     /** All AST nodes must track the file position where they are
00154         defined. */
00155     const SourcePos pos;
00156 };

00158 /** @brief Structure that defines a compilation target 
00159 
00160     This structure defines a compilation target for the ispc compiler.
00161 */
00162 struct Target {
00163     /** Initializes the given Target pointer for a target of the given
00164         name, if the name is a known target.  Returns true if the
00165         target was initialized and false if the name is unknown. */
00166     static bool GetTarget(const char *arch, const char *cpu, const char *isa,
00167                           bool pic, Target *);
00168 
00169     /** Returns a comma-delimited string giving the names of the currently
00170         supported target ISAs. */
00171     static const char *SupportedTargetISAs();
00172 
00173     /** Returns a comma-delimited string giving the names of the currently
00174         supported target CPUs. */
00175     static const char *SupportedTargetCPUs();
00176 
00177     /** Returns a comma-delimited string giving the names of the currently
00178         supported target architectures. */
00179     static const char *SupportedTargetArchs();
00180 
00181     /** Returns a triple string specifying the target architecture, vendor,
00182         and environment. */
00183     std::string GetTripleString() const;
00184 
00185     /** Returns the LLVM TargetMachine object corresponding to this
00186         target. */
00187     llvm::TargetMachine *GetTargetMachine() const;
00188 
00189     /** llvm Target object representing this target. */
00190     const llvm::Target *target;
00191 
00192     /** Enumerator giving the instruction sets that the compiler can
00193         target. */
00194     enum ISA { SSE2, SSE4, AVX };
00195 
00196     /** Instruction set being compiled to. */
00197     ISA isa;
00198 
00199     /** Target system architecture.  (e.g. "x86-64", "x86"). */
00200     std::string arch;
00201 
00202     /** Is the target architecture 32 or 64 bit */
00203     bool is32bit;
00204 
00205     /** Target CPU. (e.g. "corei7", "corei7-avx", ..) */
00206     std::string cpu;
00207 
00208     /** Target-specific attributes to pass along to the LLVM backend */
00209     std::string attributes;
00210 
00211     /** Native vector width of the vector instruction set.  Note that this
00212         value is directly derived from the ISA Being used (e.g. it's 4 for
00213         SSE, 8 for AVX, etc.) */
00214     int nativeVectorWidth;
00215 
00216     /** Actual vector width currently being compiled to.  This may be an
00217         integer multiple of the native vector width, for example if we're
00218         "doubling up" and compiling 8-wide on a 4-wide SSE system. */
00219     int vectorWidth;
00220 
00221     /** Indicates whether position independent code should be generated. */
00222     bool generatePIC;
00223 };
00224

00226 /** @brief Structure that collects optimization options
00227 
00228     This structure collects all of the options related to optimization of
00229     generated code. 
00230 */
00231 struct Opt {
00232     Opt();
00233     
00234     /** Optimization level.  Currently, the only valid values are 0,
00235         indicating essentially no optimization, and 1, indicating as much
00236         optimization as possible. */
00237     int level;
00238 
00239     /** Indicates whether "fast and loose" numerically unsafe optimizations
00240         should be performed.  This is false by default. */
00241     bool fastMath;
00242 
00243     /** Indicates whether an vector load should be issued for masked loads
00244         on platforms that don't have a native masked vector load.  (This may
00245         lead to accessing memory up to programCount-1 elements past the end of
00246         arrays, so is unsafe in general.) */
00247     bool fastMaskedVload;
00248 
00249     /** Indicates when loops should be unrolled (when doing so seems like
00250         it will make sense. */
00251     bool unrollLoops;
00252 
00253     /** On targets that don't have a masked store instruction but do have a
00254         blending instruction, by default, we simulate masked stores by
00255         loading the old value, blending, and storing the result.  This can
00256         potentially be unsafe in multi-threaded code, in that it writes to
00257         locations that aren't supposed to be written to.  Setting this
00258         value to true disables this work-around, and instead implements
00259         masked stores by 'scalarizing' them, so that we iterate over the
00260         ISIMD lanes and do a scalar write for the ones that are running. */
00261     bool disableBlendedMaskedStores;
00262 
00263     /** Disables the 'coherent control flow' constructs in the
00264         language. (e.g. this causes "cif" statements to be demoted to "if"
00265         statements.)  This is likely only useful for measuring the impact
00266         of coherent control flow. */
00267     bool disableCoherentControlFlow;
00268 
00269     /** Disables uniform control flow optimizations (e.g. this changes an
00270         "if" statement with a uniform condition to have a varying
00271         condition).  This is likely only useful for measuring the impact of
00272         uniform control flow. */
00273     bool disableUniformControlFlow;
00274 
00275     /** Disables the backend optimizations related to gather/scatter
00276         (e.g. transforming gather from sequential locations to an unaligned
00277         load, etc.)  This is likely only useful for measuring the impact of
00278         these optimizations. */
00279     bool disableGatherScatterOptimizations;
00280 
00281     /** Disables the optimization that demotes masked stores to regular
00282         stores when the store is happening at the same control flow level
00283         where the variable was declared.  This is likely only useful for
00284         measuring the impact of this optimization. */
00285     bool disableMaskedStoreToStore;
00286 
00287     /** Disables the optimization that detects when the execution mask is
00288         all on and emits code for gathers and scatters that doesn't loop
00289         over the SIMD lanes but just does the scalar loads and stores
00290         directly. */
00291     bool disableGatherScatterFlattening;
00292 
00293     /** Disables the optimizations that detect when arrays are being
00294         indexed with 'uniform' values and issue scalar loads/stores rather
00295         than gathers/scatters.  This is likely only useful for measuring
00296         the impact of this optimization. */
00297     bool disableUniformMemoryOptimizations;
00298 
00299     /** Disables optimizations for masked stores: masked stores with the
00300         mask all on are transformed to regular stores, and masked stores
00301         with the mask are all off are removed (which in turn can allow
00302         eliminating additional dead code related to computing the value
00303         stored).  This is likely only useful for measuring the impact of
00304         this optimization. */
00305     bool disableMaskedStoreOptimizations;
00306 };
00307 
00308 /** @brief This structure collects together a number of global variables. 
00309 
00310     This structure collects a number of global variables that mostly
00311     represent parameter settings for this compilation run.  In particular,
00312     none of these values should change after compilation befins; their
00313     values are all set during command-line argument processing or very
00314     early during the compiler's execution, before any files are parsed.
00315   */
00316 struct Globals {
00317     Globals();
00318 
00319     /** Optimization option settings */
00320     Opt opt;
00321     /** Compilation target information */
00322     Target target;
00323 
00324     /** There are a number of math libraries that can be used for
00325         transcendentals and the like during program compilation. */
00326     enum MathLib { Math_ISPC, Math_ISPCFast, Math_SVML, Math_System };
00327     MathLib mathLib;
00328 
00329     /** Records whether the ispc standard library should be made available
00330         to the program during compilations. (Default is true.) */
00331     bool includeStdlib;
00332 
00333     /** Indicates whether the C pre-processor should be run over the
00334         program source before compiling it.  (Default is true.) */
00335     bool runCPP;
00336 
00337     /** When \c true, voluminous debugging output will be printed during
00338         ispc's execution. */
00339     bool debugPrint;
00340 
00341     /** Indicates whether all warning messages should be surpressed. */
00342     bool disableWarnings;
00343 
00344     /** Indicates whether additional warnings should be issued about
00345         possible performance pitfalls. */
00346     bool emitPerfWarnings;
00347 
00348     /** Indicates whether calls should be emitted in the program to an
00349         externally-defined program instrumentation function. (See the
00350         "Instrumenting your ispc programs" section in the user's
00351         manual.) */
00352     bool emitInstrumentation; 
00353 
00354     /** Indicates whether ispc should generate debugging symbols for the
00355         program in its output. */
00356     bool generateDebuggingSymbols;
00357 
00358     /** Global LLVMContext object */
00359     llvm::LLVMContext *ctx;
00360 
00361     /** Current working directory when the ispc compiler starts
00362         execution. */
00363     char currentDirectory[1024];
00364 
00365     /** Arguments to pass along to the C pre-processor, if it is run on the
00366         program before compilation. */
00367     std::vector<std::string> cppArgs;
00368 };

00370 enum {
00371     COST_ASSIGN = 1,
00372     COST_COHERENT_BREAK_CONTINE = 4,
00373     COST_COMPLEX_ARITH_OP = 4,
00374     COST_DEREF = 4,
00375     COST_FUNCALL = 4,
00376     COST_GATHER = 8,
00377     COST_LOAD = 2,
00378     COST_REGULAR_BREAK_CONTINUE = 2,
00379     COST_RETURN = 4,
00380     COST_SELECT = 4,
00381     COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP = 1,
00382     COST_SYNC = 32,
00383     COST_TASK_LAUNCH = 16,
00384     COST_TYPECAST_COMPLEX = 4,
00385     COST_TYPECAST_SIMPLE = 1,
00386     COST_UNIFORM_LOOP = 4,
00387     COST_VARYING_LOOP = 6,
00388 
00389     CHECK_MASK_AT_FUNCTION_START_COST = 16,
00390     PREDICATE_SAFE_IF_STATEMENT_COST = 6,
00391 };
